Reviews.Title: “good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Row1981
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights here recently, the hotel is in a good postion for exploring rome, only a few hundred metres from trevi fountain and spanish steps, also v close to metro which is handy if you arrive from termini main train station. Rooms are small but adequate, bed and bathroom clean, fine to use as a base for city break. Breakfast was just passable- tinned fruit cheese and meats, pastries were better, orange juice out of machine was poor. Staff were helpful when we had a problem with our first room and moved us the following day. As I said good base to cool the feet after a hard days sightseeing but don't expect much else

Reviews.Title: “Just a number, never a guest”
Reviews.Author: AlexVH_11
Reviews.Content: For starters they had apparently rented out our prebooked, confirmed and prepaid room on the first of our five nights, and proposed us to walk 500m around the corner with our luggage, to another (lesser) hotel. While the quality of the rooms may have been just in line with the 3 stars, the service and hospitality of the senior staff was absolutely not. Nobody of them even apologized or offered any compensation for the arrival mishap! It is one of the worst hotels that we ever stayed at, although the location in the center of Rome is extremely convenient for visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Sandra D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Quattro Fontane is located down the street from Piazza de Spagna which makes for easy access to the city. HOWEVER, extremely poor A/C in the rooms in the middle of August makes for an uncomfortable night's sleep. Luckily, my friends and I arrived in Rome 1 night prior to our cruise departing from Civitavecchia so I was extremely relieved that I was only staying one night in this hotel, otherwise, l would have moved to a different hotel. The rooms are not very comfortable either.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again .”
Reviews.Author: cats68
Reviews.Content: Good location that's about it i gave a 2 rating for that . No soundproof between rooms could not sleep from hearing everything from the other rooms . Not that friendly staff i arrived at night and their english was bad , breakfast ok as i don't eat much in the morning and if you go late nothing left and they don't offer you anything . I think over priced for what you get .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK room, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravels
Reviews.Content: Normally I wouldn't expect the greatest service in Italy, and certainly not in central Rome - you are, after all, paying for location. However, in this case the service negatively impacted my stay and left me with a sour taste. The location is quite good...not great - there still is a short walk to almost any good sight seeing or hang out location, but quite good considering the price. The room was as expected - very small, bare-bones, and a bit dingy. Again, expected. The service however was sooooo awful. This only became an issue because my reservation was messed up. I had prepaid for a triple through another service but they had me down for a double. They made no attempt to help me resolve this saying I would need to get a refund from the company I paid to (Agoda). They wouldn't give me a receipt for anything (including the tax they asked me for before leaving), wouldn't call Agoda, wouldn't call a manager. I understand I paid a different company but they have authorized that company to take reservations on their bahalf....it is THEIR relationship and they should have made a twinge of an effort to help me resolve. I spent way too much time trying to get ANYTHING showing I had stayed in a double not a triple so I would have something to go back to Agoda with. If the Hotel wasn't going to help me at LEAST give me info to help myself. Additionally, my friend and I asked for a regular taxi to the airport in the morn (specifically said no need for the limo service). However, they had arranged the limo and we were on a time crunch to get to the airport and were stuck with the 50EUR bill. Had I more time and/or energy I should have demanded more and paid less but I was in Rome only one day and didn't want to spend more time in their lobby than I already had.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the rate”
Reviews.Author: Faithe13
Reviews.Content: Well, it was ok. Breakfast was reasonable. Location is good. But I asked for the junior suite and I got, what would be in any other hotel in the world, a standard double room. Sure we had a balcony but not worth the rate. The pictures on their site for the junior suite are very misleading. I am coming back in 2 weeks and won't be staying here. Had to pay for wi-fi too which isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, but no 24-hour airconditioning.”
Reviews.Author: paulolopez96
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a block up Piazza Bernini. When the bus driver had pulled over to drop our group off, there were no bellhops to attend to the luggage, so I had to carry up our bags from the street up about half a flight of stairs to the lobby. It was overbooked, so they merged our one Double and one Triple-sharing rooms into the Junior Suite on the fifth floor. The elevator was cramped, and could accommodate only three bags and one person. BUT THE VIEW OF THE VATICAN WAS SPLENDID! My sister got a Triple-sharing room, which was actually a loft type unit a bed at the loft, and a fold-out sofa bed on the main floor. The stairs that connected the loft were pretty steep. so if you have poor eyesight or have poor leg-muscle control, request for a standard double-sharing room instead. All-in-all, the rooms were of a decent size. We hope they used electronic key cards, but instead use old fashioned keys attached to heavy weights. We ended up leaving the keys at the front desk every time we would venture out into the city. Because of this security issue, we left our luggage locked in the rooms, instead of using the safe. The air conditioning also didn't stay on the whole night. It was fortunate that the evening was quite cold, so I opened our room windows. UNFORTUNATELY, the birds outside kept making a quacking noise that sounded like people talking loudly. I asked the front desk receptionist about the air conditioning unit the following morning and he said this was a common practice among hotels. I also inquired about this at the Hotel Anglo Americano right across the street, and they said THEY LEFT THEIR AIR AIR CONDITIONING ON 24-HOURS A DAY! But that most old hotels turned off their units at night. I didn't ask why they did this, so maybe anyone reading this review can just comment on this fact later on. The LOCATION was good, as the METRO STATION was a block down the street, as were 24-hour cafes/trattorias (the GELATOs in ROME are TO DIE FOR!!!). There is also a convenience store next door, so you can save an extra Euro on the cans of Coke, instead of drinking the ones inside the room refrigerator. If shopping is your thing, then you can easily walk 10 minutes to the Via del Corso (although walking the whole strip of Via del Corso will probably take you about 30 minutes from the Piazza Venezia all the way to the Piazza del Popolo). The Fontana de Trevi were also a 10-min walk away. The Colosseo was about 30 mins away on foot.. For first time visitors to Rome, the METRO subway system has an optional 24-hour valid ticket for 4.00 Euros. This saved us a lot of money. A WARNING: THE SUBWAY IN ROME HAS A LOT OF PICKPOCKETS! The train car was quite cramped when we went in. My sister caught some girl with her hand inside her purse, and a fight/shouting match ensued. The pickpockets were working as a team, with the 20+ year old girl picking my sister's purse, whilst another 10 year old girl was working on my mother-in-law's purse. They do not look like vagabonds, but are actually quite decent looking. You cannot hit/physically hurt them, as this would get you in trouble with the local police. What else dd I miss? The tap water is potable. The gelatos were the best. The Italians are a gorgeous people. Rome has so much history in it, and I would definitely come back again in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Aya7211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, from here you can walk almost everywhere in Rome. Hotel has a very clean room with antique taste, staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also good. The only one draw back is that the wall is a little thin and you can hear voices from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: ferner
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great .The room was small but clean and the breakfast was adequate light sleepers may have a problem as the noise from other rooms could be be heard.This is a basic Hotel for people who want to rest their weary heads after a hard day sightseeing .It was fine for us but if you are after something special look elsewhere .

Reviews.Title: “DANK Noisy, Yuk”
Reviews.Author: Robyn25
Reviews.Content: How disappointing! We flew from Australia and our first night in Rome was in this hole. I sat down on the sofa bed that sank in the middle and cried. Had i planned the trip of a lifetime at this standard? The room smelt mouldy; was too noisy when you opened a window for air; was very dark and the staff were not at all helpful, to the point that we left the place for breakfast even though breakfast was included in our room. The bath/shower water went over the floor but there was no drain hole so it just sat there. The one good thing was the location, we walked across the road and down a bit to a very nice hotel that was only the slightest bit dearer and even better located.

Reviews.Title: “great location , opposite site of audrey hepurn ' residence”
Reviews.Author: rexpaparex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3nights after getting off a cruise. We couldn't be happier with the accomodations. We had a deluxe room which is like a suite. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and made some advance reservations for us to museums and restaurants. The location, right in front of barberini Palace ( in the movie roman holidays audrey hepurn stayed there, was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel. Clean, friendly

Reviews.Title: “Bad air conditioner; HOT; noisy; small; No customer service”
Reviews.Author: happy_happy2u
Reviews.Content: We wanted to switch to another hotel so bad but we had prepaid and couldnt get a refund. I guess you live and learn. The bottom floor of the 2 bedroom 'suite' was so small that the 2 suitcase did not fit. We got the Loft suite. We wanted another room but the hotel was supposedly BOOKED. After fighting with the bald receptionist guy, who kept saying that our AC was working fine, we finally had a technician come TWICE to 'fix' the air conditioner. The 2nd technician said that the AC shutsoff automatically at 12am midnight by the hotel and wont come up till the next day... until ..??? I think it just didnt work, We had to open the windows and hear all the noises from outside while our kids sweat the night off in the LOFT. The guy in the reception desk, a bald old one is VERY rude. We have traveled in Europe before and will not go back to this one. Oh, the breakfast was Ok and the location was very nice. There are lots of hotels next to this one though.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Boring”
Reviews.Author: LuditeLincs
Reviews.Content: As a central location it was fine, but the bedroom was very small and dark. The furnishings and fittings didn't help. Are all small central Rome hotels like this? - I have nothing to compare with. The bathroom was bright and clean and well stocked. Don't agree that it was noisy - we had no problems. The staff were not at all forthcoming, despite trying to make pleasantries and conversation I barely got more than 2 words out of any of them. We had no electricity for 24 hours - tea lights didn't help the situation. But as these were only left lit on saucers on the floor along the corridors and stairs, once you got into your room it was pitch black. No explanation or apology - no breakfast - though apparently after we had gone out some pastries were left in reception for residents to help themselves to. Not their fault that the power had gone but even a knock on the door to say that food was being delivered would have been something. If all you want is a bed for the night once you have been sightseeing then it's fine but not the place to go if you're looking for something special. I'm sure there is better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Skroop
Reviews.Content: Was meant to stay at the sister hotel 'Trevi Hotel' - arrived there to be told that they were fully booked - we had prepaid with Lastminute.com who they blamed and even though we had booked over a week before no one from either the hotel or lastminute.com could be bothered to contact us about the overbooking - if they had we would bave cancelled Th room we were offered originally was tiny and dark - we complained and were given one on the 5th floor which although small was at least brighter. Service is terrible, staff are too 0 stay away

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: gaylordm
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and hotel had our reservation and room all ready to go. Helpful check in with great information. At midnight, we walked 8 minutes to Trevi Fountain. Good sized room & bathroom. Loved breakfast. Stay away from rooms overlooking the street - the car noise is irritating. Easy walk to subway, Piazza Navone & Trevi Fountain. We definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again the next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, dingy, tiny- never going back”
Reviews.Author: Parushni
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel by it's sister hotel ' stylish room'. It was a horrible small dingy overpriced hotel. The bathroom was very tiny, the water from Te shower area leaked into the room s carpet. The walls were paper thin. You could almost hear people fart in the other room. The breakfast was average and the staff was extremely rude. The junior suite is like a haunted loft. The thing that made us Stay was the location, but it's definitely not worth the price. Please please avoid this hotel and all it's sister hotels from the Trevi group.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Small, Dinghy - However, good location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyeyes33
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel to celebrate my 50th Birthday....was so excited as first time to Rome...however, all was about to change! We flew by Easyjet, flight no problem. Transfer from airport good. Hotel was so, so disapointing, I wanted to leave straight away. We arrived around 12.30 and were told our room would be ready for around 2pm, no problem. We decided to leave our luggage/bags at reception and went to discover Rome! On our return, was given key and went straight to our room; I could not wait to see what room we had been given (as the hotel were advised of my impending celebrations!). To my horror the room was very small, dark, dinghy, very noisy due to heavy traffic and constant barking from a neighbouring dog. If you are thinking of staying here I would seriously recommend taking ear plugs. I would also stress the hotel is on a hill, no problem for us but it may be for others. Breakfast was interesting. Staff could be a little more enthusiastic towards their guests. Overall, the hotel looked tired and in some parts dirty. If I knew what I knew now , I would have avoided it at all costs. It ruined my special birthday. The hotel is in a good position and that is the only thing going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: oliva
Reviews.Content: I went with some friends to expend a weekend in Rome. We had a triple room and size was adequate Althought the 3rd bed wasn´t confortable (as usual), the good location makes me recomend this hotel if you get a good price (we paid 120€/night breakfast included)

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate, but very small”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwinos
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, shower and water pressure fabulous. Location is great. You are about 15 minutes by foot to Trevi Fountain and 15 minutes by foot the train station. It was perfect for what we needed and where we needed to be. It was quite noisy in the hallway at night.

Reviews.Title: “revolting, sleepless, dreadful, it made us cry and we moved hotels”
Reviews.Author: threewiseladies
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the evening after a day full of travelling. We were exceptionally tired and were greeted with a 'sorry no porter to lift your heavy luggage up the flight of stairs to get into the hotel lobby' and therefore had to do it ourselves Our rooms were dark, gloomy and the size and shape of a shoebox with a small double bed in the middle and barely any room for our suitcases. Mine and my sisters bed sheets were stained with blood and other unidentifiable stains, upon using our bathroom we found someone elses pubic hair on the basin, and two pairs of mouldy slippers were provided (for our convenience of course). When we informed the night time receptionist he proceeded to raise his voice at us, and give my mum bed sheets (which were too small for our bed) to replace the dirty ones herself. The view from the window was lovely, it consisted of metal bars followed by wooden panels which we couldn't even open. The breakfast was even better. The food lacked variety and the quality was poor. The floor of the dining room was sticky which left us questioning the general cleanliness of the kitchen. My mum would not let us eat there so we were forced to go out and buy breakfast at a nearby restaurant. We all had a fairly sleepless night due to the tiny bed being inadequate for my sister and I to share, and the yelling coming from the reception area. Straight after we had our brekfast (elsewhere) we found another hotel nearby and moved immediately. Whatever your budget may be, when you travel you are entitled to a clean and friendly environment which quattro fontane just simply is not. DO NOT STAY THERE p.s. in our search for another better hotel, we came across a hotel/serviced apartment building only a few doors down which provides large suites with a clean, big kitchen and bathroom each as well as a living room for only 250 euros per night (less than quattro fontane). The suite we saw could accomodate up to six people (more with your own sleeping bags as there was alot of space). We highly recommend you check it out, its called Residence Barberini, and appealed to me in particular because it was decorated with modern artworks throughout the building. The receptionist was very pleasant and accomodating during our enquiry.

Reviews.Title: “a magical stay in rome at this lovley hotel”
Reviews.Author: radleyoxford
Reviews.Content: we have had 2 stays in this hotel which is ideally located we thought. its not far from the spannish steps about a 10 min walk away. its across from a small gallery. sant maria maggiore a beautiful church is a short walk away. the hotel is 3 star its a small hotel it doesnt have a bar. the small breakfast eating area is in the lower floor i.e in basement but is pleasant. the breakfast is continental style and is adequate to set you up for the day. the staff are friendly . if you are going in the months when it is hot if you have a room over looking onto the buisy street there will be traffic noise if you open the window but they have air conditioning. our first stay over looked the buisy street and with the windows closed we had no prob sleeping the room was a good size and the bathroom was adequate size. the second stay we were given a room which was at the back and it would be fair to say that the rooms view was a dark outlook onto a dark walled alley but to be honest it didnt bother us at all as we spent most of the day walking and seeing the city , if you are reasonably fit i am 51 and my husband is 55 i would say the best way to see rome is on foot. the hotel gave us a little map and we navigated succesfully on foot all round rome and we saw a lot more this way. every wednesday morning the pope will give a genral audience which either takes place in st peters square or in the audience room in the vatican. to get tickets you write to the prefettura della casa pontificia citta del vaticano. rome italy. you just give the date of the wed you are in rome for and request tickets to attend the papal audience . you let them know how many tickets you require. the vatican will send you a letter pretty quickly. and you are given instructions where to collect them from. unfortunately you do need a lenghty queue to pick the tickets up as you need to go through security at vatican but once you have picked up your tickets you can then walk round into the duomo. the tickets are free!!!!!!i me and my husband are not catholic but i will say its the most memorable event i have ever attending and i will never forget it. if you are going to the vatican museums look on the trip advisor for advice re queues. one person who lived across from the ticket office gave good advice as to the best times to go in and we walked straight in only 1 minute queue yes one minute at the ticket counter but we took the advice of the trip advisor. we went the end of march. we also found the villa bourguesse gardens and this is a lovley park if you want to get into the bourguesse gallery it is best to get tickets before you travel online as entry is limited. the first trip to rome in october we didnt get in the second trip in march we turned up without booking and we got in as sometimes they have some cancellations. we got our tickets for palatine hill colesuem and roman forum all in one at the forum ticket office(where the entrance is to the forum) the queues for the colloseum are humungous but a person on trip advsior sed get in the shortest queue as the long one was for the ticket office and if you had your combined ticket you could go striaght in. the short queue took us about 10 mins to get in and this tiem was cos they had to security screen you. but the person on trip advisor was right and i am greatful for that advice as i would have been put off by the long queue. tip there are roman soldires(men dressed up in old costumes) they allow folk to have photos taken with them but beware they expect to be paid for this. trip advisor warned of this. also lots of beggars that look like old women some prostrate on pavement in the head down kneeling positon word of caution you never see there faces . look at there hands they are mostly young folk using this scam to play on poeples consiences. also beware of fraud police . apparently trip advisor warned that they target tourists (who are easy to spot they usually have a map in hand the tourists that is) they ask to see your passport then threaten with a fine on the spot cos if you are sensible your passport is in a safe in hotle. they may then ask to see wallet to look for counterfiet bills and thats when they dash off with oyur wallet!!!! if approached ask to meet them at a locla police station. these fake police will flash an id but so quicj you cant see it they dont have uniforms . there are plenty off police around(real ones in uniform) if in doubt ask for them to accompany you to one of these visible officers. read trip advisor about pick pockets and poeple using distraction tactics to riffle your wears like bunping into you with an ice cream or ruffling a newspaper in your face. we were aware of all of these and we never had any problem with any but its best to be aware then you will probably like us be ok. back to rome. we went in the keates musuem which is on the corner at bottom of the spannish steps. its a small house and the lady there gives a good talk on keates. we walked to the cemetary which is by the pyramide where he is buried it was a lovley walk. we also visited st paulo a most beautiful church which is in this area well worth a visit. its a fair walk about 3 km from coloseum but well worth it/ there is transport to this church but the walk is where you actually see rome. we would definatley go back to the same hotel its good value for money and down the road from hotel is a shop which sells paniinis and for 3 euro each panini we had a lovley picnic in rome each day. in the evenings we went to a local supermarket and got a few cans of beer etc and we enjoyed these back in the hotel with our feet up but tip dont buy from the little shop a few doors down from hotel as we were cheated a couple of times they overcharged and short changed us and when you are not used to euros one is a bit slow to suss. also they didnt never give us a reciept from till and this is illegal in italy. we enjoyed a visit to castle st angelo and along the river tiber you can see some sellars selling wears but beware you will see the dancing mickey mouses seemingly dancing to the boom box music they dance without strings!!!!i dunno how its done but its a scam dont buy them cos when you get home you cant get em to dance . i looked it up after on internet and they warned you not to buy. luckily i only spent 2 euros the original asking price was 5 for the 2 mickey mouses

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: AnnieGrant
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon and first trip to Europe with 4 nights at the Quattro Fontane, an 18th restored mansion. We were very worried about staying here after reading the reviews on this site however our travel agent assured us it would be OK as she'd stayed there herself. At first we were taken aback by rude nonchelance of the concierge, but quickly realised it wasn’t just him: he was typical of many people we met in Italy. A lot of them are just over tourists. We made an effort to greet the staff in Italian and were always rewarded by smiles. We really enjoyed the humour of Fabrizio and Stephan, who recommended a good restaurant to us near the Presidential Palace. We even managed to engage with the breakfast staff and found them very friendly after we made the effort. We found the location excellent, although walking up the hill from Barbarini Square was a challenge after walking around Rome for up to 10 hours a day! We spent our first 4 nights in a room with a loft with very steep stairs, however it was clean and quiet. The breakfasts were typical of those we'd experienced throughout Italy - cold meat, cheese and breadrolls with croissants and cordial and coffee. The 18th Century renovated Hotel is situated within easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, the Forum and the Pantheon. There's a small deli/takeaway store located just a few doors away where you can buy food, a bottle of wine or an ice cream. The Red tourist buses stop at the bottom of the street, so it's in a handy location for sightseeing. After doing an Amalfi coast tour, we returned for our last night in Rome in a very spacious room on the top floor with views over Rome to St Peters (yes, we heard the barking dog in the apartment adjacent to the Hotel). We didn't have any problems with overbooking and enjoyed our stay. I'm sure there are more fabulous places in Rome, however this Hotel is 3 star and you get what you pay for. I'd be quite happy to stay at the Quattro Fontane again.

Reviews.Title: “awful breakfast, dark and dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: BRIGHTONLOGAN5
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is good although it's on a noisy "cobbled" road so traffic noise woke us up at night. The air conditioning didn't work. The room was dark and dingy but clean. Breakfast was bad. Brewed bitter coffee, only sweet sugared croissants, cheese, meats and yesterday's frozen hard boiled eggs, watery and crunchy with ice in the middle!. Nothing hot on offer. Rolls were fine so all I had was a cheese roll. Orange squash from the machine, no fresh orange juice. It was easy to get to all the sites in any case and we used the all day metro ticket so to avoid spending too much time working out where everything was. Rome is really expensive so would suggest you don't sit down in a cafe and have a drink. We had half pint of beer and a tiny glass of wine which cost 12 euros. Restaurants ripping off tourists in the centre with poor value and overpriced food. The hotel suggested a restaurant and we had the worst pizza. The Chicago Town ones from Iceland are better! But we spent so little time in the room because we were sight seeing all day. Would not recommend this hotel and would not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: j4oipwjgio3nq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two weeks in December. It is a nice hotel, room and shower a bit small but doable, free breakfast every morning, good room service, quiet location and thick curtains (so you can sleep day and night undisturbed). No internet in the rooms, and only one public computer with internet in the lobby ($3 an hour), but it was not occupied too often. Prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyatArms
Reviews.Content: We had are a family with two young children and needed a centrally located hotel for one night in Rome, the hotel fit the bill perfectly. We had a quadruple room with two twin beds and one queen size bed. The bathroom had clearly been updated, and the hotel was in good condition. I had no problems with my prepaid reservation through hotels.com, and the desk staff was attentitive and polite. The hotel is very close to Piazza Barbarini, and we had no difficulty walking to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. As a bonus, its also near the Capuchin Crypt. The inclusive breakfast included cereals, cold meat and cheese, hard boiled eggs, coffee or hot chocolate, and a good variety of baked goods, which was constantly replenished. I thought the hotel was a great value, and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ColosseoFinland
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was a little bit afraid of what might be ahead of us. But when we got to Rome the hotel was a very nice surprise. Yes, the rooms may be tiny (at least compared to Asian hotel rooms),but our room was very nicely decorated and bathroom was clean. Location of hotel was superb: 2 minutes to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes to Colosseum and 20 to Vatican. And we walked slowly. No need to use taxes (execpt from/to airport). Staff at the front desk was very helpful (e.g. with restaurants where to eat etc.), staff at the breakfast was ok, not the nicest one, but it didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Overbookings again!”
Reviews.Author: dubsam
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews about overbookings when I asrrived in Rome. Arrived after two train journeys in La Fenice (sister hotel) to be told there had been a problem "that morning" with their booking system and so we could not stay. I disputed this with the lady as we had booked over 3 weeks in advance but to no avail. She did not seem to care or understad that if you book onilne based on what rooms you see or the location, you would be upset that your plans are ruined. Eventually a car arrived and transferred us to Quattro Fontane. I have to say our room was fine, but am sure this was because I argued with her and heard her over the phone to the receptionist in Quattro Fontane. She offered to move us back to La Fenice in the morning but on a 2 night stay that is ridiculous especially when you're getting up early to sightsee. On a 3 day stay in Rome, losing over an hour trying to sort out a room, being driven to another hotel, finding your bearings (again) is a complete inconvenience but these people have no conscience about this and are extremely rude!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: afabrega11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights during our honeymoon. The hotel is very beautiful in a great location, but the staff really needs to shape up their hospitality skills. It seems that they are better fitted to handle a bar rather than a hotel. We would recommend this hotel for those who don't need anything at all during their trip, and this inludes asking for a map.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shamark
Reviews.Content: We had a marvellous stay at the hotel during the last week of Apr 08. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We found many choices of restaurants within a few minutes of walking. Shopping was excellent and not far away, either. I cannot comment on the metro accessibility since we taxied to and from the hotel to the airport and train station. However, if you have good walking shoes, you are off! Take your camera and enjoy the sites. Essentially, within a few minutes you could go anywhere and get just about anything. There just wasn't enough time to do all that we wanted in our four days there. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. We would also stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base camp”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsGatwick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adequate as a base camp for exploring Rome. It was clean, compact and offered basic facilities. We booked 4 double rooms for our group and all were clean, though one of the rooms had a very strong smell of smoke. The rooms had a large comfortable double bed, tv (only CNN in English), mini bar and safe. The bathroom had a shower, loo and sink. One little point was that the only power sockets were next to the door and in the bathroom meaning you had to take turns to charge phones, cameras etc. The breakfast was basic, but you could help yourself to as much as you liked. The reception staff were very helpful and ordered taxis etc which always arrived within minutes. The main plus point for the hotel is it's location. It is a short 2 minute walk to a main square which is on the route of the hop on hop off bus services. We only used this once as we walked to most places. If you are planning to go to the vatican and the colloseum, which I strongly recommend you do, you can book cabs to get there early, which were very reasonably priced. We booked our Vatican tour through 'Myvaticantours.com' this meant we joined the group at 9.15am to jump the HUGE queue and enjoyed a brilliant 3 hour tour. I can't recommend this highly enough! Our group ranged from 11yrs to adult and everyone loved the tour. The Colleseum is also a great visit, but again, get there for it opening at 9 or you'll queue for ages. There are regular guided tours beginning at 9.45 and lasting an hour. Take the time to wander over the road after your visit to the forum and gardens. We had a wonderful jam packed 3 days in Rome and we will be going back again soon as it was just so beautiful and an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ok accommodation, great location”
Reviews.Author: jbearKent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, it was clean and although the somewhat small dark room we were allocated was comfortable it had all I wanted, a clean bathroom and bed. It had a TV and mini bar with safe, and was adequate for 4 days. To be honest you spend so much time sightseeing I did not want much more. One tip, unelss you are made of money don't ask reception to recommend a place to eat, there are so many really great places to eat if you look and at very reasonable prices. The hotel is in a very good location some 5/10mins walk from the Trevi Fountain and if you pass That's Amore call in for a meal as the food and service was fab, and a good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: nzjevans
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel very pleasantly surprised me, having read other reviews (after I had booked), I was quite concerned about some of the comments that were being made and I thought I had made a mistake in booking. However: Yes, the rooms were fairly small, but they were very clean and tidy, bathrooms were clean and well stocked, and after all, we were just sleeping there. The guy(s) at reception weren't too talkative, but they were very helpful and friendly and recommended very nice restaurants and things to do. Barking dog?, heard a dog bark a couple of times but that was all. Location was excellent, 5 mins from Spanish steps, 5 mins from Trevi fountain, 1 min from Piazza Barberini wre you can catch the open top bus ride. Had a wonderful time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TouringSaffer
Reviews.Content: I was pretty concerned after booking this hotel when reading this site's reviews. However, my fears were misplaced. The hotel was decent - we had a decent sized room, a nice bathroom and it was clean. Hot water ran all day long. The reception staff were not the friendliest, but their service was ok. However, one exception to this was Stephano, who was a nice fella and sent us to a very decent restuarant. They also kindly made a booking for an airport transfer. I would say that there is nothing wrong with the hotel from our experience, except for the fact that the hotel is on a very busy street and it is noisy when the windows are open at night. 3 out of 5 is my verdict. The cost of the hotel was well within our budget. Perhaps it was due to the fact that I booked the hotel through a package tour operator, Citalia, that the hotel made an effort. I have stayed in far worse hotels in my time and this hotel was not bad at all. I suppose that the bad reviews on this site may have a lot to do with personal experience. You only hear the bad and very seldom the good. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Policastrese
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for a week in Rome, the desk clerk immediately told us he was overbooked and moved us to Hotel Trevi. He said it was a higher priced but he would cover the difference. In fact it was not higher priced. We were not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not the friendliest hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have just come back from Rome, we stayed in the Quattro Fontane for three nights. On arrival tired and weary, we did expect at the very least a smile from the the guy on reception. Instead he hardly looked at us and practically threw the form and pen at us to sign in. However he did get friendlier over the next few days. The room was very very small but clean and the shower worked well with plenty of hot water. The first night was marred by the dog barking (which I had read about from other reviews) although he did stop barking at eleven at night so we got some sleep, and we didn't really hear from him for the rest of the stay. Breakfast was fine and the kitchen staff were friendly. The hotel was situated in a good place, handy for all the sights and it was possible to walk to the Trevi Fountain, the Vatican, Spanish steps etc. Overall the hotel is an ideal base, but not for those who like a bit of luxury and attention. I would have scored this hotel a lot higher if the staff didn't treat the holiday makers as an irritation.

Reviews.Title: “good location, shame about some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: dawnie27
Reviews.Content: Was moved to this hotel as building work taking place in original hotel, only to find that building work was happening here also. No problem with this as only noise during day, when out sightseeing. Good location, nice room. Some staff could have been more friendlier and accomodating and breakfast leaves a lot to be desired. Would have been nice to have had coffee making facilities in room. Generally not a bad place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, but...”
Reviews.Author: pmagnier
Reviews.Content: We paid a deposit on this hotel in Aug 2006, by Dec we were asked for the full amount in advance which we paid. Imagine our humour then when after arriving at 3 am, we were told that our room was gone, "we waited and waited for you..." (our flight was late but not that late). For that night we transferred to a sister hotel but the room was a little smelly and opened onto an alley, a really bad arrival reminding me of my visits to Morocco in the 70s when, in some areas, absolutely everyone was trying to rip you off. However, we transferred to a nice, small (though noisy) room in the alternative hotel, very close to Trevi Fountain (I think it was Hotel Trevi) for the following night, then asked to be re-instated in Quattro Fontane for the remainder. We got an upgrade to a very good room, and enjoyed the remainder of the trip. It is very central with shops open outside at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem”
Reviews.Author: helidon
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was rather small, but you dont go to Rome and stay in your room, Staff were all very plesant, room clean and made up every day, only down side no coffee facilitys in the room, heating on from 6:00am till gone 11:00pm so room and hotel nice and warm, 1 big advantage of this Hotel is where it is situated as its only a 5min walk to Spanish steps and also the Trevi Fountain it is bang in the centre of Rome and we were able to walk to 99% of the attractions, I would recommend this Hotel with no problem. I have read all reviwes and was very cautious about the hotel as most reviews said that they had overbooking problems, also noise level were problem i.e. dog barking and traffic noise, I must say with hand on heart that we had none of the above problems, we heard a dog barking once but only for 2 to 3 mins treaffic can be heard but only slightly, over all I would quite happily stay in this hotel again 4* from me.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Meursault
Reviews.Content: We arrived very weary from a long train trip from Paris & found the hotel after a ride on the metro. The person at the desk said there were no "rooms" after the airline had given us a package deal & we were upset but they offered to put us up down the street at some residence place. We left our luggage & walked there & were surprised that it was so nice & big. It was a huge place but the small shower got plugged up so I wasn't able to shower off. The next day we were at the hotel, the room was clean, small but nothing terrible. It was difficult to pull out the bed from the sofa, as I had a broken back once, this was a hassle each night. The two beds up a loft were small & you could bang your head on the ceiling. Restroom was clean, shower only had a "partition" which allowed water to flood the floor & an annoying nozzle that fell off a few times. I was able to wash my clothes & hang it up on the balcony, even though the hotel "forbids" it, the maids never finked on me. I woke up with my own washed underpants on my face once after they fell down from above. Breakfast was mediocre, nothing great, after a while I got tired of the ham, bread & the sugary fake orange drink. Staff were like robots, exhibiting no emotion, I was waited at the desk in my travel clothes & some Italian guest looked at me as if I didn't belong there & he said something to the hotel desk man, they both laughed (probably talking bad about me, this was rude.) In all, the price seems too expensive but if you get it on a deal or package, it isn't an awful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the web site appear as if the rooms are decent, if not large for a European hotel. Our room was probably half the size of what is pictured. We had to put a suitcase in the bathroom to have room to walk by the bed. The location is good; very close to the metro and many tourist locations. The hotel staff was very friendly and breakfast was more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “We were Ripped Off!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are four ladies who have just returned from a four night stay at The Nuova Hotel Quattro Fontane. We had read reviews but as everything was already booked, just kept our fingers crossed! We arrived to be told that the two twin-bedded rooms we had booked on a low-floor area would actually be double-bedded! Told the receptionist that this would not be acceptable, so she said she had two twin-bedded rooms on the 5th Floor, which had not yet been cleaned due to the number of rooms vacated that day, but we could leave our luggage in one of the rooms and return later in the day when the rooms would be ready for us. We went to the available room and could not believe how small it was - and what appeared to be a double bed. We were told that the beds could be seperated to make two, but there was no room to do this! Told her this was not acceptable so she showed us a slightly bigger room, on another floor, which two of us could have, but the other two would have to put up with the "Shoe box" room! We asked if we could up-grade the second room, so she said OK but it would cost extra! €80 each person making a total of €320 between the four of us (don't know what happened to the free upgrade for the first room). We accepted this and enjoyed having a little more room, the breakfast was fine, the dog still barks and the noise from the traffic all night is horrendous! Hotel very central. On leaving we were charged €160 extra each not €80! As our taxi was waiting to take us to the airport, we had to pay up - but they have not heard the last of this, our travel agent is going to try to sort this out with CRESTA. WE know what price we were promised. What a "Rip Off". WE should have got it in writing!

Reviews.Title: “Fine as a base.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stay here. The bedroom and bathroom were clean and fine for a base while exploring Rome. Within walking distance of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and most other sights. Metro & taxi rank close by. Room faced the road which was a bit noisy but didnt bother us. Buffet breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy campers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in Jan 2006. Fortunately, our room was not doublebooked so we had no problem checking in unlike many others. The reception area is attractive but some people would have a problem with lugging their own bags up 10 or so steps, their is no lift access from the street to the first floor & no porter outside to help you. While this didn't bother us to much, the elderly or disabled would find it quite difficult to get in & out of this hotel. Although we were happy to take our own bag to the room the receptionist insisted that we make use of the porter who talked on his cellphone in our room until we gave him a tip. Don't mind tipping porters but he was very rude to us & a little bit intimidating. The lifts are absolutley tiny but we found this all over Italy. Our room was awful, very very small (but they describe it as spacious), one of our lights didn't work, the mini bar fridge had shelves that collapsed everytime you closed the door, the TV didn't work most of the time & the bed was hard & nasty. While being central, the noise was a bit of an issue, with the dog who lives next door barking it's head off all night not to mention that you can hear everything that goes on in the rooms around you. ie- their tv, their shower, their toilet & other activities you might expect from couples on holiday. On the day we arrived we immediately asked if we could upgrade, no matter what the cost. The rooms were all booked but the staff were far less than sympathetic. The only positive thing I will say about this Hotel is the breakfast & the breakfast staff who were a breath of fresh air after our many negative service experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and noisy nights”
Reviews.Author: carolinecag
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and it seems that we were lucky to get a room when you read some of these reviews! We checked in at midnight on a Friday and were not given a particularly warm welcome. We arrived at the room to find that it was very small and dark, but thankfully warm and clean.(The heating was easy to control too) The bathroom was also very small, but newly decorated. When I looked at the floorplan of the building it seems that each floor has 2/3 larger rooms and 8 very small ones. The shower had good pressure and plenty of hot water. Once we discovered that the external shutters opened the room was a lot brighter. The TV didn't work well, but given the choice of Italian TV or the delights of Rome itself - we were out most of the time! We found the breakfast was better than we expected - comprising orange squash, strong coffee, bread rolls and delicious pastries. The hotel is fairly well located - it is only about five minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain and the metro is very handy. The main problem that we encountered was the noise at night. We were at the back of the hotel and were frequently disturbed by dogs barking - notably the doberman on the terrace opposite. We were also disturbed by construction work in the road and by the maids hoovering the corridor at 8am. When we came to check out the young man on the desk was helpful and ordered us a taxi for later. He said that we had used some items from the mini bar, which we had not, but immediately removed these from our bill with no argument. We also had to leave our cases in reception which is not secure. Overall the hotel was a budget choice and I could have coped with the size of the room, but the noise at night would stop me from staying here again. I love my sleep..............

HotelInfo.Name: Nuovo Hotel Quattro Fontane
HotelInfo.Address: Via 4 Fontane 149/A, 00184 Rome, Italy
